repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  A right-click on the 'statuscolumn' does not open the
          popupmenu, even if a cell without a clickdef is clicked.
          Clicking the %C fold item does not open/close the fold.
Solution: Open the popupmenu when there is no clickdef like right-clicking
          the sign/numbercolumn does. Fill "linebuf_vcol" when drawing the
          'statuscolumn' to handle foldcolumn item clicks.

Ref https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32115#issuecomment-2602584032

comment_data.body: @bfredl changing your code here; `fill_foldcolumn()` now fills an array to pass on to `draw_col_buf()` so that it can set the magic vcol values for open/closing a fold for when the `%C` foldcolumn item is clicked in the statuscolumn.
Can the `vcol` parameter be omitted by passing `&wlv->vcol` as `fold_vcol` here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -368,7 +368,7 @@ static int draw_virt_text_item(buf_T *buf, int col, VirtText vt, HlMode hl_mode,
 
 // TODO(bfredl): integrate with grid.c linebuf code? madness?
 static void draw_col_buf(win_T *wp, winlinevars_T *wlv, const char *text, size_t len, int attr,
-                         bool vcol)
+                         colnr_T *fold_vcol, bool vcol)

comment_data.body:
I checked that out when writing this but no I don't think so. `wlv->vcol` is not an array, its actual value needs to be incremented here. Whereas `fold_vcol` was filled beforehand and we increment its address.

Though I guess we could check if `fold_vcol == &wlv->vcol` and change the statement based on that but I'm not sure that would be an improvement.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -368,7 +368,7 @@ static int draw_virt_text_item(buf_T *buf, int col, VirtText vt, HlMode hl_mode,
 
 // TODO(bfredl): integrate with grid.c linebuf code? madness?
 static void draw_col_buf(win_T *wp, winlinevars_T *wlv, const char *text, size_t len, int attr,
-                         bool vcol)
+                         colnr_T *fold_vcol, bool vcol)

comment_data.body: That's not what you are doing here. `(*fold_vcol)++` is incrementing the value.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -368,7 +368,7 @@ static int draw_virt_text_item(buf_T *buf, int col, VirtText vt, HlMode hl_mode,
 
 // TODO(bfredl): integrate with grid.c linebuf code? madness?
 static void draw_col_buf(win_T *wp, winlinevars_T *wlv, const char *text, size_t len, int attr,
-                         bool vcol)
+                         colnr_T *fold_vcol, bool vcol)

comment_data.body:
I.e.

```c
linebuf_vcol[wlv->off] = vcol == &wlv->vcol ? wlv->vcol++ : vcol ? (*vcol)++ : -1;
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -368,7 +368,7 @@ static int draw_virt_text_item(buf_T *buf, int col, VirtText vt, HlMode hl_mode,
 
 // TODO(bfredl): integrate with grid.c linebuf code? madness?
 static void draw_col_buf(win_T *wp, winlinevars_T *wlv, const char *text, size_t len, int attr,
-                         bool vcol)
+                         colnr_T *fold_vcol, bool vcol)

comment_data.body:
> I.e.
> 
> ```c
> linebuf_vcol[wlv->off] = vcol == &wlv->vcol ? wlv->vcol++ : vcol ? (*vcol)++ : -1;
> ```

Look more carefully. Aren't `wlv->vcol++` and `(*vcol)++` the same thing?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -368,7 +368,7 @@ static int draw_virt_text_item(buf_T *buf, int col, VirtText vt, HlMode hl_mode,
 
 // TODO(bfredl): integrate with grid.c linebuf code? madness?
 static void draw_col_buf(win_T *wp, winlinevars_T *wlv, const char *text, size_t len, int attr,
-                         bool vcol)
+                         colnr_T *fold_vcol, bool vcol)

comment_data.body: Oops you're right, it's working by accident in the current testcases then, because the fold close/open vcol values are `-3` and `-2`...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -368,7 +368,7 @@ static int draw_virt_text_item(buf_T *buf, int col, VirtText vt, HlMode hl_mode,

-                         bool vcol)

comment_data.body: If you want to increment the address you should use `*(fold_vcol++)`, and make `fold_vcol` a `const colnr_T *`.

comment_data.body: No, this is too strange.

comment_data.body: Also I wonder if the `vcol` parameter name should now be renamed to `inc_vcol` to avoid confusion.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

comment_data.body: This expression is present in both branches of the `if (out_buffer)` condition. Assign it to a variable before the condition?
Why remove the `c1` and `c2` variables? That makes the code harder to understand.
Having a static variable appear randomly in the middle of a long function is strange. Move it back to the top.
ditto
I tend to agree, though conversely reading these at the top of such a large function tells nothing about where they're actually used.
Adding right clicks for the sole purpose of avoid multiclicks is a bit awkward. How about setting `'mousetime'` to zero instead?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -713,6 +744,40 @@ describe('statuscolumn', function()
                                                                |
         ]])
       end)
+
+      it('foldcolumn item can be clicked', function()
+        api.nvim_set_option_value('statuscolumn', '|%C|', {})
+        api.nvim_set_option_value('foldcolumn', '2', {})
+        feed('ggzfjzfjzo')
+        local s1 = [[
+          {8:|}{7:-+}{8:|}{13:^+---  2 lines: aaaaa·····························}|
+          {8:|}{7:│ }{8:|}aaaaa                                            |
+          {8:|}{7:  }{8:|}aaaaa                                            |*11
+                                                               |
+        ]]
+        screen:expect(s1)
+        api.nvim_input_mouse('left', 'press', '', 0, 0, 2)
+        screen:expect([[
+          {8:|}{7:--}{8:|}^aaaaa                                            |
+          {8:|}{7:││}{8:|}aaaaa                                            |
+          {8:|}{7:│ }{8:|}aaaaa                                            |
+          {8:|}{7:  }{8:|}aaaaa                                            |*10
+                                                               |
+        ]])
+        -- Note: alternate between left and right mouse buttons to avoid triggering multiclicks
+        api.nvim_input_mouse('right', 'press', '', 0, 0, 2)
+        feed('<Esc>') -- Close popupmenu
+        api.nvim_input_mouse('left', 'press', '', 0, 0, 1)
+        screen:expect(s1)
+        api.nvim_input_mouse('right', 'press', '', 0, 0, 2)
+        feed('<Esc>') -- Close popupmenu

comment_data.body: Yes, but these two variables are used in multiple places that are quite far apart :)
I copied this from a test in `ui/statusline_spec.lua` (which you originally added, but I guess it serves another purpose there), but if that works sure.

comment_data.body:
I think there should be a blank line above this label.
```suggestion

foldclick:;
```
What is the point of this change?

No idea, probably failed to move it back to its original position after a different change. Thanks for the thorough review. 

The jump happens in `win_enter()` at line 1359, so it seems this could be moved down to before that if statement.

title: fix(mouse): 'statuscolumn' fold and popopmenu handling
